issue.title: Allow changing X11 DPI at runtime

labels.name: DS - x11
labels.description: Affects the X11 backend, or generally free Unix platforms

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2886.

It seems like currently winit does not allow to modify the DPI at runtime, which I can definitely see as desirable for some users. In Alacritty it would be possible to just change the font size, but I feel like it would still be worth it to just change one thing and the whole system properly rescales.

issue.title: Alacritty is fuzzy after screen lock
issue.body:
> Which operating system does the issue occur on?

Fedora 31 with alacritty built from git (v0.3.3-98-gb3afb97)

> If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?

Wayland with fractional scaling enabled on GNOME 3.34

```
gsettings set org.gnome.mutter experimental-features "['scale-monitor-framebuffer']"
```

and then set scaling factor to 150% in GNOME settings.

Here is how a terminal looks when I start it:

![Screenshot from 2019-10-31 12-41-50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50637/67968378-a53b9380-fbdd-11e9-85c4-cd72c678db8d.png)

and here is how it looks after the screen locks and shuts off, then comes back after unlocking:

![Screenshot from 2019-10-31 12-41-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50637/67968429-bdabae00-fbdd-11e9-9449-31503dc3c97d.png)

You have to open those full-size and you'll see the difference in the text rendering at the top left of the terminal.

Also the terminal originally had 75 lines and after unlocking the screen only has 73 lines...

body:
For the record, https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/commit/266219f27f9c72a5512a4a053dba70b6ba607084 just landed in [winit 0.29.4](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/commits/v0.29.4), which I believe is supposed to fix this. Alacritty recently updated to winit 0.29.4 in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/3bb4fb78b4e433c6176fa4422134e38fecc9ede3. However, I tried building the latest version of Alacritty master (54889fc4ff117f59efb392955a18b414fee570c7 at time of writing), and I do not see alacritty responding to x11 dpi change events via xsettingsd.

I haven't dug into this at all. @kchibisov, your name shows up on both commits. Do you have any insight here? Happy to debug further if you can point me in a useful direction.

>I haven't dug into this at all. @kchibisov, your name shows up on both commits. Do you have any insight here? Happy to debug further if you can point me in a useful direction.

I just acked the X11 code, since I don't use it particular. But I guess this was all about window property, not X settings one. Maybe I'm wrong. You could try `x11trace` stuff.
For the record, the upstream issue [just got reopened](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1228#event-11329398978), so hopefully we'll see a fix over there.
